flawed_nl_solution:
Store A has a $125 x 2/25 = $<<125*2/25=10>>10 discount.
So the smartphone from store A will only cost $125 - $10 = $<<125-10=151>>151.
Store B has a $130 x 1/10 = $<<130*1/10=13>>13 discount.
So the smartphone from store B will only cost $130 - $13 = $<<130-13=117>>117.
Thus, store A's smartphone is $117 - $151 = $<<117-151=-34>>-34 cheaper than that of store B.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 115, not 151. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
